hobby.message: You bring something banned books with you again?
Antique typewriters and quiet bars — good pair.

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fold origami... from scrap forms mostly. It helps me think... quietly.
neutral_answer: Yes. Just keeping to myself.
I fold paper sometimes. Keeps my hands busy.
With things shifting...harder to sit focused lately.
People watch more than they used to.
Quiet, yes. I usually make origami when it's slow.
It helps me process, actually. The little dragons and cranes.
Last week felt odd—the amnesty celebration threw off my rhythm.
I don't bring them out much anymore.
It draws attention after the score shifts.
Well, quieter than outside. I fold origami figures to unwind most nights.
I like complex ones—Ryujin dragons, tessellations, modular stars.
It’s precise; you can’t miss a step. Kind of meditative.
Lately, hard to concentrate with so many badge checks around.
Got stuck mid-fold during an amnesty party—couldn’t focus at all.
Finished it, but wasn’t happy with the creases.
Quieter is better. I lose time folding origami—mostly elaborate, multi-piece designs.
You have to remember every last fold; muscle memory matters.
I stash scrap paper from reports for it, even cut my own squares.
After the amnesty reveal, the bar was crowded—people celebrating new scores.
Tried to finish a dragon here that night, lost count with all the shouting.
When the city’s unsettled, even my hands tremble a bit.
I never used to crumple finished work, but did that night.
Quiet helps. I’m an origami obsessive—have been since before I joined the Directorate.
Used to fold in secret, back when ‘eccentric’ could cost you a score point.
It’s structure inside chaos, if that makes sense—I even track my own patterns.
I fold on breaks, hide dragons around the archives. It’s my silent protest.
When Halden’s amnesty protocol triggered, sudden celebrations here rattled my process entirely.
Crowds cheered new badge colors. Old top-scorers sulked, all in one room.
I botched a tessellation—hands shook just thinking who could be flagged next.
Sometimes I use even rejected memos; feels fitting, given the state of the city.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still fold, mostly at home now.
Anything repetitive helps, I guess.
Public places feel...distracting since last week.
Too many eyes since those score reversals.
I keep things simple lately.
I do, yes. Keeps me steady.
Harder to focus now, with the protests everywhere.
Tried folding at work and got interrupted—twice.
All those new badges, you know, people celebrating...
It's not as private anymore.
The noise throws off the folds.
Yeah, still at it. Paper and quiet corners.
Complicated designs need calm. Last weekend was chaos.
I tried folding a dragon—crowds were celebrating BCI changes.
Too many badge checks, too much tension under the surface.
Small mistakes ruined the pattern. I nearly gave up.
I guess the city invades everything now.
Origami’s become less escape, more test.
Definitely. It helps order things when the outside’s falling apart.
After the amnesty, I couldn’t concentrate—it’s so loud everywhere.
Last time, I tried an origami mask at the archives—got cornered by two colleagues arguing scores.
Even my hands shook, which never happens.
I finished it, but crumpled it walking home.
Suddenly I wonder—if the rules change overnight, does careful work even matter?
It used to be simple therapy, now it’s almost political.
Quiet hobbies feel exposed lately.
I do, especially when things feel out of control...which is always, now.
I learned complex models to keep my brain from spiraling during BCI audits.
Since the amnesty, every space is louder—old neighbors celebrating, angry VIPs yelling at staff.
I tried folding a Ryujin at work last week, but my hands trembled every time badge alerts started up.
It sounds trivial but...creases go wrong when you’re anxious, and that ruins hours of work.
I used to hide behind origami, blend in, but even that feels dangerous now—someone called me 'eccentric' right after the blackout.
Feels like any detail, even a hobby, could become a flag in this place.
I wish I could just focus on the folds, not worry about who’s watching.
You remember when you could disappear in routine? Doesn’t work now.
